verses.kjv: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
verses.ct: The wicked run away even when no one is chasing them, but the righteous are as confident as a lion.

verses.kjv: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.
verses.ct: When a nation rebels, it ends up with one ruler after another, but with a leader who has wisdom and knowledge, stability lasts.

verses.kjv: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
verses.ct: A poor person who exploits other poor people is like a driving rainstorm that destroys the crops and leaves nothing to eat.

verses.kjv: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.
verses.ct: Those who abandon God's instruction end up praising the wicked, but those who follow it stand up against them.

verses.kjv: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.
verses.ct: Evil people don't understand justice, but those who seek the LORD understand it completely.

verses.kjv: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
verses.ct: It's better to be poor and live with integrity than to be rich and walk a crooked path.

verses.kjv: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.
verses.ct: Whoever follows God's instruction is a wise child, but anyone who hangs around with wild and reckless people brings shame to their father.

verses.kjv: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
verses.ct: Whoever grows their wealth through excessive interest and unfair profit is just collecting it for someone who will be generous to the poor.

verses.kjv: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.
verses.ct: If you refuse to listen to God's instruction, even your prayers become disgusting to him.

verses.kjv: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.
verses.ct: Whoever leads an honest person down a wrong path will fall into their own trap, but those with integrity will receive good things.

verses.kjv: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
verses.ct: A rich person may think they're wise, but a poor person with real understanding can see right through them.

verses.kjv: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.
verses.ct: When righteous people succeed, there is great celebration, but when the wicked gain power, people go into hiding.

verses.kjv: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
verses.ct: Whoever hides their sins will not succeed, but whoever confesses and turns away from them will receive mercy.

verses.kjv: Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
verses.ct: Blessed is the person who always maintains a reverent heart, but whoever hardens their heart will fall into disaster.

verses.kjv: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.
verses.ct: A wicked ruler over helpless people is like a roaring lion or a charging bear.

verses.kjv: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
verses.ct: A leader who lacks sense is a terrible oppressor, but one who hates dishonest gain will enjoy a long life.

verses.kjv: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
verses.ct: A person burdened with the guilt of murder will be a fugitive until death — let no one help them.

verses.kjv: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.
verses.ct: Whoever lives with integrity will be kept safe, but whoever walks a twisted path will suddenly fall.

verses.kjv: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
verses.ct: Whoever works their land will have plenty of food, but whoever chases empty pursuits will have plenty of poverty.

verses.kjv: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
verses.ct: A trustworthy person will overflow with blessings, but whoever rushes to get rich will not go unpunished.

verses.kjv: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.
verses.ct: Showing favoritism is never good — yet some people will do wrong for something as small as a piece of bread.

verses.kjv: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.
verses.ct: A greedy person is in a hurry to get rich, not realizing that poverty is heading straight for them.

verses.kjv: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.
verses.ct: Someone who offers honest correction will eventually be appreciated more than someone who just says what you want to hear.

verses.kjv: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.
verses.ct: Whoever steals from their father or mother and says, 'There's nothing wrong with that,' is no different from someone who destroys.

verses.kjv: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.
verses.ct: A greedy person stirs up conflict, but whoever trusts in the LORD will prosper.

verses.kjv: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
verses.ct: Whoever relies on their own judgment is a fool, but whoever lives with wisdom will be kept safe.

verses.kjv: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
verses.ct: Whoever gives to the poor will never be in need, but whoever looks the other way will receive many curses.

verses.kjv: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
verses.ct: When the wicked gain power, people go into hiding, but when the wicked fall, the righteous thrive.
